section_title: Variables and Data Types in Python
section_description: This section introduces the fundamental building blocks of any Python program: variables and data types. You will learn how to store information using variables and explore the core data types that Python uses to represent different kinds of data.
learning_objectives: Define and assign values to variables using the assignment operator (=).
Identify and use the four primary data types: strings, integers, floats, and booleans.
Check the data type of any value using the type() function.
Perform basic operations and concatenation appropriate to each data type.

lessons.lesson_objective: Create and use variables to store and retrieve data.
key_topics: Concept of a variable as a named container for data
Naming rules and conventions for variables (snake_case)
Printing the value of a variable using print()
Reassigning new values to existing variables

exercises.exercise_instructions: 1. Create a variable named 'greeting' and assign it the value 'Hello, World!'. 2. Create a variable named 'year' and assign it the number 2024. 3. Use the print() function to display the value of both variables.

lessons.lesson_objective: Manipulate textual (string) and numerical (integer, float) data types.
key_topics: String data type: storing text within quotes
Float data type: numbers with decimal points

exercises.exercise_instructions: 1. Create two variables: one string containing your first name and one containing your last name. Concatenate them with a space and print the full name. 2. Create variables for a product's price (9.99) and quantity sold (5). Calculate and print the total revenue.

lessons.lesson_objective: Use boolean values and identify the type of any variable.
key_topics: Boolean data type: True and False values
Getting the type of a value with the type() function

exercises.exercise_instructions: 1. Create a variable 'is_student' and set it to True. 2. Check if 100 is greater than 50 and store the result in a variable named 'result'. 3. Print both variables and their data types using the type() function.

lessons.lesson_objective: Combine different data types and variables to create a simple program.
key_topics: Review of variable assignment and naming
Review of core data types (str, int, float, bool)
Writing a simple script that uses multiple variables and types

exercises.exercise_instructions: 1. Create variables for a user's name (string), age (integer), height in meters (float), and whether they are a new user (boolean). 2. Print a summary message that concatenates these values into a readable sentence. Hint: You will need to convert the non-string values to strings using str().
